Cara Pyne  MEng   
 10 Clarence Drive, CW8 2EQ

07840336133  
 
I am an enthusiastic individual  who is keen to develop in a Continuous Improvement focused role. My experience 
in varying manufacturing facilities  has given me the confidence that I can adapt quickly to new  challenges  and 
work across business groups . My s trong interpersonal skills , eagerness to succeed and conscientious approach 
allows me to fit well in to teams and lead sites on their continuous improvement journeys.     
 
Key Skills  
I believe my strengths lie in both my ability to build rapport quickly within teams through open communication 
and my technical skill that h ave allowed me to adapt and thrive in  new situations.  
• Collaboration

I am an enthusiastic individual  who is keen to develop in a Continuous Improvement focused role. My experience 
in varying manufacturing facilities  has given me the confidence that I can adapt quickly to new  challenges  and 
work across business groups . My s trong interpersonal skills , eagerness to succeed and conscientious approach 
allows me to fit well in to teams and lead sites on their continuous improvement journeys.     
 
Key Skills  
I believe my strengths lie in both my ability to build rapport quickly within teams through open communication 
and my technical skill that h ave allowed me to adapt and thrive in  new situations.  
• Collaboration  
• Communication  • Data Analysis  
• Lean Implementati on • Mentoring  
• Prioritisation  
 
Key Achievements  
• Highest week output of 2.5million loaves surpassed during Covid.  
• Led site to achieve £250k of Savings against target of £189k  per annum . 
• Mentored two management team peers to achieve their Green Belt certifications.  
• Designed and implemented 7 -week multi variable analysis to enable $36MM platform upgrade.  
• Led process optimi sation of insourced packaging line.  
 
Work Experience  
Value Stream Manager , Roberts Bakery                                    Jan 2020 – Present  
Value Stream Manager for two bread plants at Roberts Bakery. Focusing on driving world class manufacturing 
opera tions, agile systems, and continuous improvement within a matrix structure.  During this role I have started 
my Black Belt Apprenticeship.  
Lean Implementation: Created, implemented, and governed the Short Interval Control (SIC) and tiered review 
meetings in the Value Stream. Driving improvements through data analysis, quick wins,  and problem -solving  
methodologies.  I developed the  root cause analysis process and documentation for the Bakery including the 
training and mentoring of  Shift Managers, Engineers and supporting functions on the tool pack.    
Business Improvements:  Worked across business functions to identify improvements within their processes, 
this helped to build the continuous improvement culture in non -production areas  of the business;  redesigned 
the complaints process and reports with the Technical team to allow clear areas of focus to be identified.  
Data Analysis : Used data analysis skills to diagnose and analyse production and financial data to identify and 
prioritise key projects.   
 
Continuous Improvement Lead, Ornua Ingredients UK                           Jan 2018 – Jan 2020  
CI Lead , initially for one site then expanded my responsibilities , across  two cheese processing facilities and 
manage d the operation trainers at both sites. Focused on  efficiency improvement projects, waste reduction and  
leading  sites on their journey to Operation al Excellence .   
Efficiency Improvements: Led the Kaizen w orkshops and facilitated the Green Belt and White Belt projects at a 
production site which resulted in an increase in OEE of 9% in 2018 , alongside an uplift in run rate resulting in a 
24% reduction in labour hours per tonne.  Leading the site to achieve £2 50k of Savings against target of £189k 
per annum , which was celebrated with a planned shutdown and outside catering for the whole site.  
Data Analysis: Standardised data analysis and reporting across Global Ornua Ingredients business and identified 
as the k ey contact for reporting through Tableau software.  Allowing the SLT to have direct  comparison between 
six manufacturing facilities  and providing the business with visibility of the capacity opportunities.  
Lean Implementation: Developed Short Interval Control and Daily Operations reporting and structure across 
manufacturing facilities, including simplifying the process to determine production targets in a complex 
environment with over 20 SKUs per line per day. Mentored two management team peers  to achieve their Green 
Belt certifications. Introduced controlled methods of sample production and new product set up working with 
commercial and sales teams to ensure ease of use alongside technical and master data requirements.  
 
Work Experience Continue d 
Manufacturing Technology Engineer, 3M Aycliffe                        Dec 2016 – Jan 2018  
Worked as the main production support engineer concentrating on process improvement, waste reduction and 
machine introduction projects within a $36MM/year  capacity c onstrained business.  
Machine Qualification: Led the commissioning and qualification of a new injection moulder with integrated 
robotics; including process optimisation, recipe sequencing, SOP creation and training of maintenance and 
operations staff. Led training and process optimisation during production line insourcing to increase output by 
over 40% in three months.  
Data Analysis: Used my statistical background and process knowledge to design, trial and implement a 7 -week 
multi variable analysis from raw  material characteristics and storage conditions, production settings to finished 
product performance.  This process understanding study and my analysis has been used to increase the 
robustness of current products and enable the launch of a new product rang e.  
 
Graduate Engineer, 3M Loughborough                                May  2016 – Dec 2016  
Broadening my  pharmaceutical experience, moved to be part of the team commissioning and qualification of a 
new $23MM inhalation production line in a GMP environment.  
Facility Qualification: Managed the qualification of the facilities including writing validation docum entation, 
coordination of facility classification testing and analysis of results.  
Lean Six Sigma: Used my Green Belt training to assess and improve the efficiency in the new production facility, 
creating material flow procedures and implementing lean met hodologies to maximise line output.  
Change Control:  Decommissioned existing  equipment , including gaining approval from the global business and 
planning safe deconstruction and removal within an ATEX environment. Supported SAP introduction to the site.  
 
Graduate Engineer, 3M Aycliffe                                    Sep 2015 – May 2016  
Joined 3M’s optimised operations graduate scheme  concentrating on projects that both produced area savings 
and reduced pain points for operators . 
Process Improvements:  Reduced operator intervention to replenish raw materials by 40% which als o gave $16k 
waste savings. Generated  and perform ed a design of experiment s to assess and optimise output without 
compromising quality leading to a 4% increase in output on a capacity constrained line.  
Prioritisation : Developed  several solutions to reduce waste on a production line , using  a six-sigma  prioritisation 
matrix to gain capital fundin g to replace  a pneumatic station with servo drives.   
 
Summer Vacation Placement, ExxonMobil Fawley                                  Jul 2014 – Aug 2014  
 
Industrial Placement, GSK Barnard Castle                    Jul 2012 – Jul 2013  
Worked in a technical t eam supporting  troubleshooting  activities , new product introductions, material 
characterisations, process,  and material changes.  Worked on a site  wide project rationalising recipes and bills 
of materials used in the SAP system.  
 
Education  
Chemical Engineering  MEng , Newcastle University               Sept 2010 – Jun 2015  
Achieved a first -class Master of Chemical Engineering with Honours degree. Final year research project used 
specialist equipment including atomic force microscopy for “Mimicking the O steosarcoma Tumour Cell Surface”. 
I was awarded a prize for the best design project presentation by industrial experts for my work involving large 
scale hydrogen production using novel technologies.  
 
Belfast Royal Academy                       Sept 2003 – Jun 2010  
A-Levels:  Mathematics (A*), Further Mathematics (A), Biology (A), Chemistry (B) and Physics (B).  
GCSEs:   4 (A*) and 7 (A) grades.  
 
Training / Certificates
• Udemy  Certified LSS Black Belt Training  (In Progress)  
• ISL5 (Black Belt) Apprenticeship (In Progress)  
• Internal Auditing (Aug 2020)  • Level 2 HACCP (Jan 2020)  
• Level 3 Food Safety  (Jul 2019)  
• Ornua Managing Matters (Oct 2019)
